business.headline: More trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group as government launches probeMore trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, Corporate Affairs ministry launches probe into fund diversion

Lenskart IPO GMP falls sharply before listing. Is it heading for a weak debut?Lenskart's IPO, which opened for subscription on October 31 and closed on November 4, received an overall subscription of 28.27 times, as per exchange data.
8th Pay Commission: 5 things you need to knowThe 8th Pay Commission sets up a major revision in salaries and pensions. Here are key things you need to know.

Porter layoffs: 300 employees impacted as startup trims workforce, says reportThe company confirmed the layoffs on Tuesday, saying the move was part of a broader effort to make the organisation more efficient and financially resilient.

Explained: What rising demand for gold says about global economy As inflation worries persist and geopolitical risks grow, is the world turning to gold because economies are strengthening or because everyone is preparing for tougher financial times ahead?

Man calls Zerodha's Rs 5 crore withdrawal limit scam. Expert explains why it's notZerodha, India's largest retail brokerage platform, was blocking an investor's fund withdrawal. He called the incident a "scam" and accused the company of using his money for free.

Home prices surge up to 19% in top cities. Why buying is getting tougherFresh data from PropTiger shows property prices jumping 7% to 19% in the July to September quarter. Read to know the factors driving the surge in prices.

Can gold prices climb past Rs 1,25,000 again? Here's all you need to knowGlobal politics, central bank moves and investor nerves are all tightening the screws. Will gold finally get the spark it needs to push past the Rs 1.25 lakh mark?

Finance Buddha IPO: Anchor book oversubscribed before issue opening on November 6The IPO consists entirely of a fresh issue of 50.48 lakh shares in the price band of Rs 140 to Rs 142 per share. The issue opens for subscription on November 6 and closes on November 10.

Paytm delivers Rs 211 crore profit in Q2FY26, driven by AI-Led efficiency and cost disciplineOperating revenue grew 24% year-on-year to Rs 2,061 crore, led by growth in subscription merchants, higher Gross Merchandise Value (GMV), and continued expansion in financial services.

Unconditional cash transfers to women increasing fiscal pressure on states: ReportThe report notes that the number of states implementing UCT schemes for women has increased sharply from just two in 2022–23 to twelve in 2025–26.

Nvidia joins India Deep Tech Alliance as group secures $850 million boostThe alliance, launched in September 2025 with an initial commitment of $1 billion, aims to close the funding gap faced by research-driven startups in India.

China suspends 24% tariff on US goods for a year, keeps 10% levyThe announcement comes shortly after last week's meeting between Chinese President Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump, which marked a step towards easing trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Tougher renewable norms may cloud India's clean energy growth: ReportThe proposed regulations, introduced by the Central Electricity Regulatory Commission (CERC) in September 2025, aim to make renewable power suppliers more accountable for maintaining grid discipline.

Guru Nanak Jayanti holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?Apart from the scheduled holidays, the stock market also remains closed on all Saturdays and Sundays as part of the regular weekend schedule.

Nobody bigger than institution: Mehli Mistry in parting note to Tata Trust trusteesIn a letter addressed to all trustees, including Chairman Noel Tata, Mistry wrote that his loyalty to Ratan N Tata's vision comes with a duty to keep the Tata Trusts free from controversy. He noted that any escalation of internal matters could cause lasting damage to the organisation's reputation.

Reliance Group clarifies: ED-attached assets belong to Rcom, business unaffectedReliance Group said that the action has no impact on the business operations of Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Power.

Is India's tax system fueling the IPO rush? Zerodha's Nithin Kamath thinks soIndia's booming startup economy may be running on a system that rewards valuation over value, and growth over resilience, says Nithin Kamath.

Hinduja Group Chairman Gopichand P Hinduja dies at London hospitalGopichand P Hinduja, who represented the second generation of the influential business family, took charge of the multinational Hinduja Group in May 2023, following the death of his elder brother, Srichand P Hinduja.
Sensex ends 519 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Eternal down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 519.34 points to close at 83,459.15, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 165.70 points to end at 25,597.65.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Mona Singh says people keep asking why she does mother's roles Actor Mona Singh spoke to us about the overwhelming response to 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. She opened up about why she keeps choosing motherly roles and whether Season 2 of the series is on the cards.

Delnaaz Irani reflects on nepotism: Unfair to compare Khushi Kapoor with Sridevi Delnaaz Irani reflected on the unfair comparisons faced by star kids in Bollywood. She highlighted the immense pressure they endure and called for recognising their individual talents.

Indian Matchmaking's Sima Taparia reacts to Nausheen Ali Sardar's claim: Read here 'Indian Matchmaking' star Sima Taparia has responded to actor Nausheen Ali Sardar's claims that she refused her services due to religion, clarifying she did so "out of innocence." The popular matchmaker also addressed trolling and fame, saying she enjoys both positive and negative publicity alike.

Sebastian Stan: Timothee Chalamet, Austin Butler doing roles I couldn't at their age Sebastian Stan expresses admiration for younger actors as Timothee Chalamet and Austin Butler. He also talks of life beyond Bucky Barnes or the Winter Soldier

Rajinikanth, Kamal Haasan unite for Thalaivar 173, eye Pongal 2027 release Rajinikanth will star in 'Thalaivar 173', directed by Sundar C and produced by Kamal Haasan's RaajKamal Films International. The film is scheduled for a Pongal 2027 theatrical release.

Bigg Boss 19 finale postponed? Show getting a one-month extension, say reports The finale of 'Bigg Boss 19' could get pushed back. Reports are rife that the reality show is likely to get an extension with new contestants and recent evictions creating a stir.

Bob Dylan gets honorary degree from Berklee College, calls it pleasant surprise Bob Dylan received an honorary doctorate degree from Berklee college of music. The institute is hosting a tribute concert to celebrate his contribution to music on November 5, 2025.

JioHotstar this week: The Fantastic Four, All's Fair and more This week on JioHotstar, viewers can look forward to Marvel's much-awaited reboot 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' and Ryan Murphy's legal drama 'All's Fair' starring Kim Kardashian and Sarah Paulson. From superhero action to powerful courtroom storytelling, the platform's new releases promise entertainment for all.

Jungkook's 'GOLDEN: The Moments' exhibition to debut in Mumbai this winter BTS' Jungkook's solo exhibition 'GOLDEN: The Moments' will open in Mumbai this winter. The event marks HYBE India's effort to bring global music experiences closer to Indian fans.

A$AP Rocky calls fatherhood with Rihanna heaven after welcoming daughter The rapper discusses his experience as a new father to a daughter, shares thoughts on parenting, and celebrates his Fashion Icon Award win alongside Rihanna at a major industry event.

Inspection Bungalow trailer: Zee5 series promises a chilling yet heartwarming ride Zee5 has announced a new Malayalam web series, 'Inspection Bungalow', described as a blend of horror and comedy, with its premiere scheduled for November 14.

Zohran Mamdani's Dhoom Machale moment a big high for India's soft power: Pritam Zohran Mamdani's historic win as New York City's mayor was celebrated with the iconic 'Dhoom Machale' track. Composer Pritam Chakraborty called the moment a proud reflection of India's growing cultural footprint.

Namit Das marks Zohran Mamdani's mayoral win with heartwarming 2017 throwback pics Namit Das shared throwback photos along with a note to celebrate Zohran Mamdani's mayoral win. He became New York City's youngest and first Muslim mayor.

Daniel Day-Lewis slams Brian Cox for dragging him into method acting debate Daniel Day-Lewis has responded to Brian Cox's criticism of Jeremy Strong's method acting. The exchange sheds light on the pressures and controversies surrounding intense acting techniques.

Harshvardhan Rane just took over this franchise from John Abraham. Read here Basking in the success of 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat', actor Harshvardhan Rane has announced his next film. He will be taking over a popular franchise from actor John Abraham.

Prime Video, Sony LIV, ZEE5: Maxton Hall S2, Maharani S4 and more This week's OTT lineup brings a mix of emotions and genres - from the political drama 'Maharani 4' and the romantic youth series 'Maxton Hall 2' to the heartwarming family dramedy 'Thode Door Thode Paas'. With new releases on Prime Video, Sony LIV, and ZEE5, there's something fresh for every kind of viewer.

Shabana Azmi praises Zohran Mamdani's win, says Trump spread negative publicity Zohran Mamdani has made history as New York City's youngest and first Muslim mayor, winning a closely contested election at just 34. Shabana Azmi hailed his message of social justice and inclusivity in a note.

Agatha Christie's Seven Dials on Netflix. When does the murder mystery premiere? Streaming platform Netflix has revealed new details and a trailer for its forthcoming adaptation of Agatha Christie's Seven Dials, featuring Mia McKenna-Bruce, Helena Bonham Carter, and Martin Freeman.

AR Rahman launches Rooh-e-Noor, an all-women band celebrating Indian music AR Rahman introduces Rooh-e-Noor, a six-member all-women ensemble led by Khatija Rahman on Wednesday. The ensemble's world premiere is scheduled for November 21 this year at the Tanweer Festival in Sharjah.

general news.headline: No vote chori: Woman named in Rahul Gandhi's presser with Brazilian model's photoIndia Today tracked down one of the voters whose ID card allegedly featured the Brazilian model's photo, as alleged by Rahul Gandhi. The woman said there was a printing error in her voter ID card, and she had cast her vote in 2024 with the help of Aadhaar card.

PM Modi felicitates Women's World Cup champions at his residence in New Delhi Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the Women's World Cup-winning Indian cricket team at his residence in New Delhi, congratulating Harmanpreet Kaur and her squad for their historic triumph over South Africa. The champions received a grand welcome in Delhi after ending India's long wait for a World Cup title.

India's pollution refugees: Fleeing Delhi's toxic air for cleaner pasturesDelhi's worsening air pollution is forcing families to move for better health. Experts stress that moving is not a solution, urging urgent policy action.

Seema, Sweety, who? Rahul Gandhi claims Brazil model 'voted' 22 times in HaryanaA Brazilian model's photograph allegedly appearing 22 times on the Haryana poll rolls became the centrepiece of Rahul Gandhi's explosive voter fraud charge against the BJP and the Election Commission.

How three Muslims with Indian roots left Trump with a black eyeThree Muslim Democrats of Indian origin, Zohran Mamdani, Aftab Pureval, and Ghazala Hashmi, have handed US President Donald Trump his first political setback within months of him becoming the President.

Delhi Capitals set to release Meg Lanning before auction: SourcesDelhi Capitals are set to release skipper Meg Lanning ahead of WPL 2026, ending her three-season stint as captain after leading the team to three consecutive finals. The franchise has retained Jemimah Rodrigues, Shafali Verma, Marizanne Kapp, Annabel Sutherland, and Niki Prasad.

Moon comes close to Earth: Science behind supermoon explainedWhen a full moon occurs at or near perigee, it looks up to 14 per cent bigger and 30 per cent brighter than when it is farther away at apogee, the point in the orbit when the Moon is farthest from Earth.​

Video: Estranged Tej Pratap, Tejashwi's chance encounter and awkward silenceTej Pratap Yadav, the elder son of Lalu Prasad, was in the middle of an interview with Samdish Bhatia when he ran into Tejashwi. The two estranged brothers crossed paths but not words during the chance encounter.

Mamdani, Adani, Ambani. The linkThough New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani champions socialist politics in New York, his surname traces back to the same Gujarati roots as that of corporates Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani. Across the seas and centuries, these family names tell a story of commerce, migration and shared histories.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

Mumbai housing society pulls out all stops for coach Amol Muzumdar's homecomingIndia's World Cup-winning women's team coach Amol Muzumdar received an emotional homecoming in Vile Parle, where women from his neighbourhood lined up with raised bats to form a guard of honour as he returned after guiding India to their first ODI World Cup title.

Won't let a Khan become Mayor: Mumbai BJP chief after Mamdani's NYC winMumbai BJP chief Ameet Satam warned voters against electing a Muslim in the upcoming local body polls. His remarks, made on social media, came after Zohran Mamdani was elected NYC mayor.

Defying norms, two women marry in Bengal's SundarbansThe two women had met two years ago and developed a close relationship. They got married at a temple ceremony in Sundarbans, with locals extending their support.

Namo 1: Harmanpreet Kaur, team India gift special signed jersey to PM ModiThe Women's World Cup-winning Indian team had a special gift for Prime Minister Narendra Modi as they met him at his official residence in New Delhi on Wednesday, November 5.

Rahul Gandhi is lying: Haryana Chief Minister hits back at 'vote chori' chargeHaryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini dismissed Rahul Gandhi's allegations of large-scale voter fraud as "lies", accusing the Congress leader of misleading the public.

Rajinikanth, Kamal Haasan unite for Thalaivar 173, eye Pongal 2027 releaseRajinikanth will star in 'Thalaivar 173', directed by Sundar C and produced by Kamal Haasan's RaajKamal Films International. The film is scheduled for a Pongal 2027 theatrical release.
Zohran Mamdani's three rings and the stories they holdEach of the three silver rings Zohran Mamdani wears every day tells a different story.

David Beckham is now Sir David Beckham: Football great knighted by King CharlesDavid Beckham has been formally knighted for his services to football and British society. The former England captain received the honour from King Charles III during a ceremony held at Windsor Castle in Berkshire on Tuesday.

Of bullets and lies: How US prosecutors kept Subu Vedam in jail for 43 yearsSixty-four-year-old Subramanyam Vedam, an India-born man who spent 43 years in a US prison for a murder he did not commit, has received a reprieve from two American courts. Both courts have stayed his deportation after he was booked by the ICE after being released from jail. How could the prosecutors keep him behind bars for decades? Here's everything you need to know about Subu Vedam's story.

The future is already here: Meet the James Dyson Award 2025 global winnersThe James Dyson Award 2025 has crowned two global winners: OnCue, an adaptive keyboard that helps people with Parkinson's type confidently using cues and haptics; and WaterSense, an autonomous river-monitoring system that predicts contamination 72 hours in advance. Both innovations are human-centred, accessible, and ready to scale.

Cadet no. 1: The story of India's first woman to join the Indian ArmyIn 1992, Major Priya Jhingan became the first woman officer in the Indian Army's non-medical branch. Her pioneering role opened doors for many women, transforming the army's approach to female officers.

Mira Nair beams with pride as son Zohran Mamdani becomes New York's youngest mayorZohran Mamdani made history by becoming the youngest and first Muslim mayor of New York City, defeating Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa. His win is being celebrated by family and supporters, especially his mother, filmmaker Mira Nair.

UP Warriorz have gone for a full reset with Deepti's release.

PM Modi recalls Amanjot's World Cup final catch, clears Harmanpreet Kaur's doubt Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the World Cup-winning Indian women's cricket team in Delhi, praising their resilience and recalling key moments from the final, including Amanjot Kaur's juggling catch that shifted the game in India's favour.

Richa Ghosh to be honoured by CAB after Women's World Cup heroics Richa Ghosh will be felicitated by the Cricket Association of Bengal with a gold-plated bat and ball at Eden Gardens for her stellar World Cup performance, where she played a key role in India's title win.

IND A vs SA A 2nd Unofficial Test: Squads, livestreaming details and more India A and South Africa A are all set to lock horns in the second unofficial Test in Bengaluru with some big names in action. KL Rahul, Kuldeep Yadav and Temba Bavuma will be some of the stars on show during the game.

Rishabh Pant Roars Back! Named Vice-Captain for South Africa Test Series. This special report covers the BCCI's announcement of the Indian Test squad for the upcoming series against South Africa, highlighting the return of star wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant as vice-captain. According to reports, 'when Rishabh Pant got injured during the England series, it was a big blow for Indian side because you know as far as Rishabh Pant's space in the team India is concerned, always you know everybody rates him very highly'. Pant, who suffered a foot fracture during the England tour in July, has proven his fitness by leading the India A side against South Africa A. The two-match Test series is scheduled to begin on November 14 in Kolkata, with Shubman Gill captaining the 15-member squad.

The franchise has retained Jemimah Rodrigues, Shafali Verma, Marizanne Kapp, Annabel Sutherland, and Niki Prasad.

Watch: Novak Djokovic in tears after tribute to late coach Nikola Pilic Novak Djokovic broke down in tears after an emotional tribute to his late coach Nikola Pilic, who passed away in September at the age of 86. Djokovic beat Alejandro Tabilo in the second round of the Hellenic Championship.

Shubman Gill won't take long to adapt, play all three formats for India: Shane WatsonShane Watson believes that Shubman Gill won't take too long to get accustomed to the demands of the playing for India across all three formats.

Mohammed Shami, Karun Nair ignored for SA Tests despite strong Ranji Trophy formIND vs SA Tests: Despite strong recent performances in the Ranji Trophy, Mohammed Shami and Karun Nair have been left out of India's squad for the upcoming Test series against South Africa, as selectors opt to back younger batting options and focus on long-term plans.

No Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in India A squad for South Africa one-dayersIndia A have named Tilak Varma as captain for the upcoming one-day series against South Africa A. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were not considered for the series, which will help the white-ball specialists prepare for the three-match ODI series against South Africa in November – December.

Rishabh Pant back as BCCI announces squad for two-Test series vs South AfricaRishabh Pant has made his return to the Indian Test squad as BCCI announced the 15-member side for the upcoming series against South Africa.

No Chhetri as India reveal probables list for Asian Cup qualifier vs BangladeshIndia have decided to drop Sunil Chhetri from the probables list for the AFC Asian Cup qualifier against Bangladesh. Chhetri came back to the Indian team in March this year, reversing his retirement call from last year.

Nothing like Yograj Singh: Yuvraj dismisses comparisons to father's coaching styleYuvraj Singh says his coaching style is built on empathy and understanding, not the strict discipline he grew up with under his father, Yograj Singh. He admitted that his mentorship of Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill has been shaped by patience, trust and years of shared hard work.

Champions in Delhi: PM Modi to honour India's World Cup-winning women's cricket teamThis special report focuses on the Indian women's cricket team, led by Harmanpreet Kaur, being felicitated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi. This follows their historic maiden ICC Women's Cricket World Cup victory in 2025 against South Africa. The Prime Minister stated that 'this win is going to inspire millions of youth'. The felicitation mirrors the honour given to the men's team after their T20 World Cup win in 2024, highlighting the significance of this achievement. The team's journey to the top has been a long one, marked by near misses in the World Cup finals of 2005 and 2017. This victory is seen as a revolution for women's cricket in India, with players like Smriti Mandhana, Deepti Sharma, and Shafali Verma becoming inspirations for a new generation.

What's holding Shubman Gill back in Australia T20Is? Ex-pacer discussesIndia vs Australia, 4th T20I: Former pacer Zaheer Khan urged vice-captain Shubman Gill to play with freedom and trust his natural instincts. Gill has endured a lean run since his return to the T20I side in the Asia Cup.

Cristiano Ronaldo hints he will retire soon to spend time with familyCristiano Ronaldo reveals he will retire soon, shares personal goals and thoughts on Manchester United's recent decline. The football icon discusses preparations for life after football.

George Bailey rejects Steve Waugh's concerns over Australia's ageing Test lineupSelectors for Australia have reaffirmed their faith in the core of seasoned players for the Ashes squad, brushing aside criticism from ex-captain Steve Waugh. The move reignites discussions about succession, with most squad members past their 30th birthday.

WPL 2026 Retention Highlights: Meg Lanning set to be released by Delhi CapitalsWPL 2026 Retention Highlights: The six teams in the Women's Premier League are set to announce their retentions and releases for the upcoming edition of the tournament. The mega auction is set for November 27 in New Delhi. The Mumbai Indians are the defending champions.

Bangladesh women's captain blasts ex-teammate for rumours over beating juniorsBangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty has strongly denied former teammate Jahanara Alam's allegations of misconduct, calling them baseless and driven by personal grudges. The BCB also backed Joty, labelling Jahanara's claims malicious and aimed at undermining team unity.

1st T20I: West Indies survive Santner scare to seal thriller, take 1-0 leadWest Indies overcame a late onslaught from skipper Mitchell Santner to edge past New Zealand in the T20I series opener. Santner's unbeaten 55 off 28 balls nearly powered the hosts to an extraordinary comeback win.

With T20 World Cup dream in mind, Matthew Short ready to move down the orderMatthew Short said that he is ready to bat down the order for Australia in a bid to make it to the squad for the T20 World Cup 2026. Short has been batting at No.7 during the ongoing series against India.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli unlikely to play in South Africa A one-day series: ReportDespite speculation that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli might use the India A games to stay match-ready, the senior duo is now expected to skip the South Africa A one-dayers beginning November 13.

Once a king, always a king: Yuvraj, Kuldeep lead wishes for Virat Kohli's birthdayVirat Kohli's 37th birthday saw heartfelt wishes pour in from teammates, former players and family, with Yuvraj Singh leading the tributes, celebrating Kohli's passion, legacy and unmatched impact on Indian cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
